title: Unable to Install MyEtherWallet
body:
- **Bug Report**
  - What is the current behavior?
I am trying to install MyEtherWallet locally by following the Getting Started steps (https://github.com/MyEtherWallet/MyEtherWallet/). However, I am unable to complete this install.
  - If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem
Steps taken:
1. `git clone https://github.com/MyEtherWallet/MyEtherWallet.git`
2. `cd MyEtherWallet/`
3. `npm i`
At this point I start to receive errors. Terminal output is as follows:
```bash
usr@ubuntu:~/Downloads/MyEtherWallet$ npm i
npm ERR! cb() never called!

npm ERR! This is an error with npm itself. Please report this error at:
npm ERR!     <https://npm.community>
usr@ubuntu:~/Downloads/MyEtherWallet$ npm i
npm WARN eslint-plugin-vue@4.7.1 requires a peer of eslint@^3.18.0 || ^4.0.0 but none is installed. You must install peer dependencies yourself.
npm WARN bootstrap@4.3.1 requires a peer of jquery@1.9.1 - 3 but none is installed. You must install peer dependencies yourself.
npm WARN eslint-plugin-prettier@3.1.0 requires a peer of eslint@>= 5.0.0 but none is installed. You must install peer dependencies yourself.
npm WARN truffle-hdwallet-provider@0.0.6 requires a peer of truffle@4.x but none is installed. You must install peer dependencies yourself.
npm WARN uglifyjs-webpack-plugin@0.4.6 requires a peer of webpack@^1.9 || ^2 || ^2.1.0-beta || ^2.2.0-rc || ^3.0.0 but none is installed. You must install peer dependencies yourself.
npm WARN myetherwallet@5.0.13 No license field.

audited 829351 packages in 32.794s
found 66 low severity vulnerabilities
  run `npm audit fix` to fix them, or `npm audit` for details
usr@ubuntu:~/Downloads/MyEtherWallet$ npm run build

> myetherwallet@5.0.13 build /home/usr/Downloads/MyEtherWallet
> npm run update && vue-cli-service build


> myetherwallet@5.0.13 update /home/usr/Downloads/MyEtherWallet
> npm run update:packages && npm run update:lists


> myetherwallet@5.0.13 update:packages /home/usr/Downloads/MyEtherWallet
> node package-test.js

new update found vee-validate 2.2.9 2.2.10 2019-06-08T13:50:32.662Z
new update found ethereumjs-tx 1.3.7 2.0.0 2019-06-07T08:20:29.213Z
new update found prettier 1.17.1 1.18.2 2019-06-07T14:55:43.212Z
new update found secp256k1 3.7.0 3.7.1 2019-05-31T10:12:55.374Z
new update found stylelint 10.0.1 10.1.0 2019-06-07T14:31:44.418Z
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! myetherwallet@5.0.13 update:packages: `node package-test.js`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the myetherwallet@5.0.13 update:packages script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/usr/.npm/_logs/2019-06-18T15_56_26_470Z-debug.log
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! myetherwallet@5.0.13 update: `npm run update:packages && npm run update:lists`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the myetherwallet@5.0.13 update script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/usr/.npm/_logs/2019-06-18T15_56_26_495Z-debug.log
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! myetherwallet@5.0.13 build: `npm run update && vue-cli-service build`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the myetherwallet@5.0.13 build script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/usr/.npm/_logs/2019-06-18T15_56_26_515Z-debug.log

```

As can be seen from above, the "npm ERR! cb() never called!" error does not happen again the next time the `npm i` command is run.

  - Please tell us about your environment:
    - Operating system: Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS, inside a virtualbox virtual machine
    - nodejs: v8.16.0
    - npm: v6.4.1

I would be very grateful if someone could assist me with this?

@tomwalton78 As the error suggests, please update your package.json with the proper versions:
```
new update found vee-validate 2.2.9 2.2.10 2019-06-08T13:50:32.662Z
new update found ethereumjs-tx 1.3.7 2.0.0 2019-06-07T08:20:29.213Z
new update found prettier 1.17.1 1.18.2 2019-06-07T14:55:43.212Z
new update found secp256k1 3.7.0 3.7.1 2019-05-31T10:12:55.374Z
new update found stylelint 10.0.1 10.1.0 2019-06-07T14:31:44.418Z
```

`<package name> <current package version> <version to update to>`

@gamalielhere 

Thank you. I updated the package.json file in the MyEtherWallet directory with the newer versions, however now I receive new errors. This is my terminal output:

  COPY Release/secp256k1.node

So I installed @vue/cli-service with: npm install -g @vue/cli-service and that fixed that error.
I had similar errors with other packages, so I fixed those by installing:
- npm install -g @vue/cli-service
- npm install -g @vue/cli-plugin-babel
- npm install -g @vue/cli-plugin-eslint
- npm install -g @vue/cli-plugin-pwa
- npm install -g @vue/cli-plugin-unit-jest
- npm install -g vue-template-compiler

Now I have an error about running out of memory, which seems odd to me, since I am running this on a machine with 12 GB of memory:

```

npm ERR!     /home/usr/.npm/_logs/2019-06-18T18_17_30_383Z-debug.log
```

After further research I have managed to fix the out of memory issue via:
export NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=8192

Then I needed to rebuild several modules in order to progress past some other error messages:
npm rebuild node-sass
npm rebuild optipng-bin
npm rebuild jpegtran-bin
npm rebuild mozjpeg

Now I am encountering a rather vague error message upon running `npm run build`. More specifically, this message appears as a result of the `vue-cli-service build` command. Any ideas?

```
⠙  Building for production...(node:2321) DeprecationWarning: Tapable.plugin is deprecated. Use new API on `.hooks` instead
 ERROR  Error
Error
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:190:19)
    at onErrorNT (internal/child_process.js:362:16)
    at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:139:11)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:181:9)
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! myetherwallet@5.0.14-hotfix.2 build: `npm run update && vue-cli-service build`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the myetherwallet@5.0.14-hotfix.2 build script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/usr/.npm/_logs/2019-06-26T16_28_51_389Z-debug.log

```

I have now finally managed to get the install to work. Below is all of the steps I took to overcome the various errors that occurred.

Follow install steps given on GitHub README

(1)
If `npm i` fails the first time, try running command again.

(2)
Need to install these packages:
npm install -g @vue/cli-service @vue/cli-plugin-babel @vue/cli-plugin-eslint @vue/cli-plugin-pwa @vue/cli-plugin-unit-jest vue-template-compiler opencollective

(3) https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38558989/node-js-heap-out-of-memory
export NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=8192

(4) https://github.com/sass/node-sass/issues/1579
npm update
npm install
nodejs node_modules/node-sass/scripts/install.js
npm rebuild node-sass <- should be the important one

(5) https://github.com/imagemin/optipng-bin/issues/84
npm rebuild optipng-bin
npm rebuild jpegtran-bin
npm rebuild mozjpeg

(6)
If complains about deleting node_modules/websocket, delete it manually

(7) npm rebuild not working
Edit package.json to contain latest version of "canvas" package
npm i
npm rebuild

npm run build
npm start
I just finally got this to work on v9.10.1 - thanks! The `npm rebuild` was really much needed.

@tomwalton78 Did you ever make a PR to add `export NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=8192` into the build documentation in the README? I tried to follow it and ran out of memory too. It seems the build won't work by default, although `NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=2048` is sufficient for me.
I have been repeating the installation all day, and I narrowly think that this project is not open source, it may be deceptive! ! ! 🤣
I can’t access my wallet at this time I am a truck driver and my recovery phrase is at home, please don’t shut down my account for inactivity
@rdotterer09 It's not possible for MEW or anyone else to shut down your wallet for inactivity, and anyone telling you otherwise is probably doing it to create a sense of urgency for a scam.

Ok thank you

How do I add a test account for development so I can add fake amounts?
